Question: This person (pron.: /?ple?to?/; Greek: ??????, Plát?n, "broad"; 428/427 BC[a] – 348/347 BC) was a philosopher in Classical Greece.
Hints: Dicaearchus went so far as to say that this person wrestled at the Isthmian games.
Perictione gave birth to Pyrilampes' second son, Antiphon, the half-brother of this person, who appears in Parmenides.
That apprehension of Forms is required for knowledge may be taken to cohere with this person's theory in the Theaetetus and Meno.
